channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Old bin left on pavement, 23rd October
item.description:
No number on the bin so cannot be returned but no lid - rubbish being put in it including dog poo bags. In Hudson Road, outside 2 and 4 Herbert Road gardens

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hudson Road, Upper Belvedere, London

item.title: Car parked between and obstructing pavement dropped kerbs, 23rd October
item.description:
Hi there , this vehicle is prevent access from the 244 bus stop to the NHS centre by obstructing the pavements dropped kerbs. Thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thames Reach, London

item.title: Dangerous hole in pavement by busy pedestrian crossing, 23rd October
item.description:
This hole has been here for 2 or 3 weeks. It's a dangerous hazard on a busy pedestrian crossing used by people to reach the tube, the secondary school and Lidl. Needs fixing urgently before someone twists/breaks their ankle or trips and falls into the Main Road. Its quite deep now.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Stockwell Terrace, Stockwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken Street Electrical Junction Box, 23rd October
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 160, Old Street, Finsbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ongoing cyclist problems, 23rd October
item.description:
Cyclists continue to use this footpath at speed. I recently tried to call one out and ended up in an argument. A neighbour politely spoke to another who ended up verbally abusing her. Yesterday two men in balaclavas rode down there on powered bikes, which was intimidating and highly dangerous. I took a video of this but the site would only accept images. I'm hoping something practical can be done about this before someone - either cyclist or pedestrian - gets seriously hurt.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thayers Farm Road, New Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Always large amount of litter/tin cans/bottles at the back of shelter, 23rd October
item.description:
Location: Bus stop BT, traffic flow towards Bromley, it serves large residential area and Bishop Justus School. Always has a large amount of rubbish/litter in the under growth at the rear of shelter. Feels like standing on the edge of a rubbish tip. While school is closed can the area behind shelter, the under growth of shrubbery be given a good rack out and cleaned. Many, Many thanks as this problem spoils the environment,.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A21, Bromley Common, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bicycle parking stand vandalised, 23rd October
item.description:
The bicycle parking stand on the pavement at the junction of Bedford Street and Henrietta Street has been vandalised. Thieves have cut through the stand to steal a bike. The stand is now unusable.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19, Bedford Street, Bloomsbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet
